image.altText: A man named Admiral Stephen Koehler speaks at a lectern while wearing full dress military uniform.

props.synopsis: Just 24 hours after Chinese Premier Li Qiang dined on West Australian lobster and rubbed shoulders with the state's powerbrokers, a US Navy chief uses his Perth visit to urge a cautious approach to Australia's rekindled relationship with the superpower.

title.children: 'Fixated on power': US Navy chief issues warning on China amid WA's thawing relationship with superpower

image.altText: A man shoots a rifle

props.synopsis: The WA government says its new firearms laws are the toughest in the country, “making explicit that the possession and use of a firearm is a privilege but not a right”, according to the police minister.

title.children: WA now has the 'toughest firearms laws' in the country. So who can keep their guns?

image.altText: A black shopping basket sitting on a kitchen bench that contains bread, mince, carrots, apples and milk.

props.synopsis: Basic grocery items are 25 per cent cheaper at Aldi when compared with Coles and Woolworths, a new report from Choice has found.

title.children: Aldi stores 25pc cheaper than Coles, Woolworths, Choice report finds

image.altText: A man and woman with hard hats and high vis shirts.

props.synopsis: With hundreds of jobs set to go following the closure of a local mine, the Shire of Ravensthorpe is pitching itself as a potential community hub to miners in other parts of the state.

title.children: Remote council pitches FIFO hub plan to big miners in bid to maintain population

image.altText: Three men talking

props.synopsis: The coal mining town, 200km south of Perth, is one of seven sites identified by the Coalition as the potential site for a nuclear reactor under Peter Dutton's nuclear energy proposal.

title.children: On the streets of Collie, opinions are split on Peter Dutton's plan to build a nuclear reactor in town

image.altText: A man with a shaved head, wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton has broken every single rule when it comes to unveiling radical policy as opposition leader, tearing up the script and gambling with his party's chances at the next election with his nuclear policy. Can he pull it off?

title.children: Peter Dutton has placed a target on his back. Is his nuclear policy cunning genius or political self-destruction?

image.altText: Dozens of wind turbines scattered across the horizon.

props.synopsis: Local governments in regional Western Australia say a growing number of renewable energy projects need to be balanced against local land use requirements and community interest.

title.children: Local councils seek guidelines to balance renewable energy projects with agriculture

image.altText: a nuclear generating station can be seen with water infront of it.

props.synopsis: Coalition promises that nuclear power will make for cheaper electricity prices don't stack up, according to an energy analyst, who says there was no evidence anywhere in the developed world to suggest new reactors were pushing down prices.

title.children: 'An absolute stretch': Dutton's promise nuclear will make for cheaper power questioned

image.altText: Black labrador dog laying on grass wearing guide dog banner and purple vest

props.synopsis: Kids and families have reported a reduction in stress and anxiety with waggy-tailed Winston, a black labrador, by their side.

title.children: Research backs statewide rollout of support dogs at WA Children's Courts

image.altText: A crowd watching a screen with a man in a turban on it.

props.synopsis: Hezbollah has accused Cyprus of allowing Israel to use its airports and bases for military exercises.

title.children: Hezbollah leader says 'no place' in Israel would be safe in war, threatens Cyprus for first time

image.altText: A man wearing military garb with weapons pointing at a piece of paper on the wall.

props.synopsis: In an interview on Israeli TV Daniel Hagari said the idea of destroying Hamas is throwing sand in people's eyes, drawing criticism from the prime minister's office and a military clarification.

title.children: Israel's chief army spokesman says Hamas cannot be eliminated in apparent growing rift with political leadership

image.altText: A row of men shearing sheep.

props.synopsis: Populations in WA’s Wheatbelt have long been in decline because of a shrinking agricultural workforce. Local communities fear the impending live sheep export ban may be the final blow.

title.children: Communities in WA fear looming ban on live sheep exports will be death knell for their small towns

image.altText: A CCTV grainy photo of a white utility on a road.

props.synopsis: A 27-year-old pedestrian dies after an alleged road rage incident in Western Sydney as police search for the driver of a ute they say hit the man before fleeing the scene.

title.children: Police search for ute driver over alleged fatal road rage attack in Western Sydney

image.altText: Two men are shaking hands and holding folders while standing in front of country flags.

props.synopsis: Vladimir Putin has visited North Korea for the first time in 24 years, signing a new partnership that one expert has described as an anti-West coalition.

title.children: Vladimir Putin and Kim Jong Un agree to deploy 'all means' if the other is pushed into war

image.altText: RBA governor Michele Bullock at press conference

props.synopsis: Rate rise after rate rise should have sent the economy into a tailspin, but the RBA isn't fighting a textbook case of inflation.

title.children: What's driving our inflation? And would more rate rises fix the problems?

image.altText: Fleur Connick at scenic restaurant on Cat Ba Island, Vietnam.

props.synopsis: The incidence of TB in Australia is low, but experts say we must remain alert to the disease, particularly with the growing threat of drug-resistant TB. This is what you need to know.

title.children: Doctors told me I'd be 'very unlucky' to have TB in Australia. A week later I tested positive

image.altText: The scene where a woman was shot and killed by an alleged shooter in South Mackay.

props.synopsis: Police allege the man shot and killed a 34-year-old woman while she was sitting in her car outside a Robb Place residence in South Mackay at about 4:30pm on Wednesday.

title.children: Woman taking two children to sport randomly shot dead in Mackay, 31yo alleged shooter faces court

image.altText: A man in a suit, seen from behind, looks at the ASX share price boards.

props.synopsis: The ASX200 has slipped lower after a weak lead from European markets. Wall Street was closed overnight for a federal holiday. Mexican fast-food chain Guzman Y Gomez to list on the ASX today.

title.children: Mexican fast-food chain Guzman Y Gomez listing today, ASX down slightly, super funds on track for strong returns

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Guzman y Gomez shares surge on debut, but that's not the full story
ASX flat as miners and banks tread water
Guzman Y Gomez shares begin trading $8 higher than listing price

image.altText: Penny Wong in a dark pantsuit and Richard Marles in a dark suit and red tie sitting at a table.

props.synopsis: The Australian Government has announced it will provide $2 million in extra funding to assist Papua New Guinea's recovery response to last month's devastating landslide in Enga Province.

title.children: Australia to provide $2 million in extra funding to assist with PNG's landslide recovery

image.altText: A woman with chin-length auburn hair with blue glasses and a blue suit  smiles

props.synopsis: Eagers Automotive has reimbursed over 13,000 underpaid staff after the car dealer discovered the anomalies and self-reported to the Fair Work Ombudsman.

title.children: Australia's largest car dealership, Eagers, back-pays $16 million to underpaid workers

image.altText: A screenshot of bodycam footage released of police questioning Baldwin on set of Rust.

props.synopsis: The evidence, which includes images and video from crew and a set photographer, shows Mr Baldwin pointed his gun at a crew member and fired a blank round, held his finger on the trigger when not supposed to and engaged in horseplay with the weapon.

title.children: New evidence in Alec Baldwin Rust trial shows he pointed gun at crew members before fatal shooting

image.altText: A baby moose head pokes up from between a float plane and dock on a lake.

props.synopsis: An Alaskan man and two police officers rescued a baby moose from a "sure demise" after the animal became stuck between a lake float plane and dock.

title.children: 'He just kept slipping and slipping': Police save baby moose at Alaskan lake

image.altText: A young woman sits on a couch, in front of a laptop with two printed bills in her hands, looking shocked.

props.synopsis: Is your car insurance policy due for renewal soon? If you're a loyal customer, your insurer may not be giving you the deal you deserve.

title.children: Car insurers expect you to be 'lazy' with finding a better deal — here's how to beat them

image.altText: A baby receiving a vaccination while being held by his mother

props.synopsis: Health experts spotlight "creative" solutions Australia can adopt in the face of growing under-vaccination of children and spread of vaccine-preventable diseases like measles.

title.children: Measles surges globally as immunisation in Australia suffers setback. Are we at risk of an outbreak?

image.altText: Charlise Mutten smiling holding two plush toys, next to her mother

props.synopsis: Justin Laurens Stein being found guilty of murdering nine-year-old Charlise Mutten has allowed for the release of dozens of files of evidence, including his police interviews and phone calls to his mother recorded in jail.

title.children: These are the events that culminated in Justin Stein being found guilty of murdering 9yo Charlise Mutten

image.altText: Coalition politicians stand on the floor of the house of representatives.

props.synopsis: The Coalition could press on "in the national interest" to establish nuclear reactors in seven communities even if locals oppose it, despite previously suggesting it would only progress nuclear on the condition that host communities approve.

title.children: 'We believe it's in the community's interests': Dutton would not give locals nuclear veto

image.altText: A road sign displaying five of the Ten Commandments sits behind a fence, with a mobile crane on its left.

props.synopsis: The poster-sized displays will be paired with a four-paragraph "context statement" on the religious text's role in the US education system.

title.children: The Ten Commandments are going up in every Louisiana public school under this new law

image.altText: A group of soldiers can be seen around an excavator working in a field

props.synopsis: Overgrown trees and shrubbery appear to be the cause behind 30 North Korean soldiers crossing the demarcation line separating the two countries, who are still technically at war.

title.children: What led to warning shots at the North Korean border?

image.altText: David Popovici with his gold medal at the 2024 European Aquatics Championships.

props.synopsis: Australian star Kyle Chalmers will have his work cut out in Paris after Romanian David Popovici swims the third-fastest 100 metres freestyle of all time at the European Championships.

title.children: Chalmers to face stiff competition at Paris Olympics as rival comes close to breaking world record

image.altText: A photo of Keith Kerinauia being escorted by a prison security guard at the BWS Airport Tavern bottleshop.

props.synopsis: A jury has found Keith Kerinauia guilty of the murder of Darwin bottle shop worker Declan Laverty, following an eight-day trial in the NT Supreme Court.

title.children: Keith Kerinauia found guilty of murder of Darwin bottle shop worker Declan Laverty

image.altText: A dachshund wearing a pink harness stands between a person's legs, looking to the left

props.synopsis: Pet ownership can offer a wealth of positives for many people, but for those experiencing homelessness, the costs can be insurmountable.

title.children: Poppy, Ash and Smiley all have one thing in common — alongside their owners, they are homeless

image.altText: Bruce Hodge

props.synopsis: Two NSW police officers are facing assault charges following a confrontation with 92-year-old Ronald Hogan at his Picton home after his wife, who has dementia, called triple-0. The couple's son is calling for aged care reform.

title.children: Son of elderly man allegedly assaulted by police says aged care system is 'overloaded'

image.altText: A man in a blue morph suit controls an emu puppet in a large bush field

props.synopsis: The great emu war of 1932 is as baked into Australian lore as vegemite and chucking a sickie after a big weekend. A new film from some of our country's brightest comedy makers turns the tale into an ocker Apocalypse Now.

title.children: Absurd, chaotic delight: This is the great emu war as you've never seen it before
